page.title: 18OLD HUTTON CHURCH
page.content: { The church of St. John the {Baptist}was built by{W. Fawcett}in 1874, using stone from{Holmescales {Quarry.}Rev. David Fowler, who lives at Grayrigg Vicarage, is the present vicar.{A silver chalice}dated{1495 (reputed to be one of only{six}in the country) is deposited in the{bank,}but is used at{Easter Communion.}The{organ was{renovated}in{1984}at a cost of Â£1,400. Part of the burial ground actually belongs to the{Parish {Council.}A{Garden of Remembrance}has had to be{set aside}because{burial {space}will become desperate before the {turn of the century. {Opposite}the church is{Chapel {House,}where{Rev. John Wesley}is reported to have spent the{night of {October 3rd, 1740}on his way from {Whitehaven to Leeds.
